title: Squirt Gun Fonts? Swank Army?
content:
Somwhere back in the late 90's while I was typesetting at a small print shop I happened across Squirt Gun Fonts. They produced Crass (a stencil looking font) and Rez. These ring any bells? They were part of the Swank Army?   
   
Anyone know what happened and/or where I might find the Squirt Gun font library now?
author: kojo

comments.content:
Not quite. It was a collective of designers that used to inhabit http://www.swanky.org. Twisted Type (another one you may have heard of) was a member found at [http://tt.swankarmy.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018214316/http:/tt.swankarmy.net/) and [www.swankarmy.net/twisted](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018214316/http:/www.swankarmy.net/twisted).   
   
The last known address I have for Squirt Gun is:   
 [http://start.at/squirtgun](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018214316/http:/start.at/squirtgun)   
   
The site seems to all be there but none of the font files are available.

Heres one of them on a free site.   
   
 [http://desktoppub.about.com/library/fonts/dd/crass.zip](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018214316/http:/desktoppub.about.com/library/fonts/dd/crass.zip)
